Nery Inés is requesting a loan to carry out home improvements that she has wanted to undertake for a long time but due to a lack of money, she has not been able to. With the loan she will buy cement, paint, ceiling panels and other construction materials.

loans.use: to buy cement, paint, ceiling panels and other construction materials.

loans.name: Silvia Maria

texts.es:
La señora Silvia, hoy en dia trabaja como ayudante de cocina, logrando tener un salario fijo, su pequeño negocio no procedio, devido a que clientes que dio credito no pago. Lo que su inventario disminuyo.
Sus dos hijos siguen estudianto, y su esposo, labora como ayudante de bodega. Como objetivo es la mejora  a su casa, en donde va por parte mejorando, ya que no cuenta con todo el capital, hoy hara un muro en la parte de atra, reguardando su seguridad y propiedad. Comprara materiales en piedra, arena, cemento, hierro para comenzar. Gracias a los prestamos sera posible esta obra a corto plazo.estando contenta.
texts.en:
Señora Silvia is currently working as a kitchen assistant, affording her a fixed income. Her small business is at a standstill due to the fact that customers to whom she gave credit facilities did not pay her. Therefore her inventory has decreased.

Her two children are still students and her husband works as in a grocery store. Her goal is to make home improvements which have been started but she does not have enough money. She will build a back wall to maintain the security of the property. She will buy materials such as stone, sand, cement and iron to begin with. Thanks to the loans this work will be possible in the short term which makes her happy.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as stone, sand, cement and iron to being building a wall.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, tiene 39 años, es separado, vive en su casa en la ciudad de Paraguarí.  Ricardo se dedica a la venta, carga y reparación de baterías para vehículos desde el año 1997, gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos y al trabajo garantizado que realiza le va muy bien su negocio, cuenta con clientela formada, además realiza la venta de aceite, fluido y otros.
Comenta que por medio de su trabajo puede ayudar a su familia con los gastos que día a día surgen en la casa, y asi a la vez sentirse útil.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de baterías, con lo cual podrá surtir su negocio y de esa forma seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Ricardo, 39, lives in the city of Paraguari.  He lives in a house in Paraguari and is separated from his wife.  He started a business buying and repairing car batteries in 1997.  He's been successful because he guarantees his work and provides good products.  He also sells motor oil and other merchandise and says that he can count on a loyal set of customers.
Ricardo tells us that the income he earns from his business help cover family expenses, expenses that are increasing by the day.
Ricardo is applying for a loan that he will use to stock his batteries business.  The investment will allow him to continue operating the business and supporting his family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his retail business.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Exitosas Group

texts.es:
Doña Ileana es la tesorera de Banco Mujer Exitosas, con 30 años de edad, es madre de 2 niñas una de 4 y otra de 2 años de edad, con quienes vive junto a su compañero. Ella una mujer muy emprendedora,  ha incursionado en varias áreas comerciales y de servicios, tiene mucha experiencia en la negocios.  Actualmente está dando los primeros pasos de una microempresa de CHOCO-BANANOS, que consiste en la elaboración y venta de bananos confitados y rellenos; el negocio es familiar y lo desarrolla con su mamá y una cuñada que también son integrantes del grupo. 
Este es el segundo crédito que solicita el grupo, y el crédito se va a invertir en la remodelación de un local, para acondicionar una pequeña fábrica, así como comprar equipo, tales como congeladores y otros insumos necesarios. 
Ileana debe trabajar muy duro para cumplir con los pedidos que ya le solicitan, incluso debe levantarse a las 3 de la madrugada, para poder trabajar y también realizar las labores de su hogar, así como darle el cuidado que sus hijas requieren ya que son muy pequeñas. 
Ella tiene muchas metas propuestas, y está decidida a alcanzarlas, entre ellas está consolidar su negocio y convertirlo en una fábrica con presencia en el mercado, mejorar la condición económica de su familia y la calidad de vida, pero sobre todo ser una microempresaria exitosa, ejemplo para sus hijas y otras mujeres de su comunidad, demostrándoles que con esfuerzo y trabajo todo se puede lograr. 
Junto a Ileana están en el grupo 7 socias más que también realizan actividades de pequeña industria y comercio.
texts.en:
Ileana is the treasurer of Banco Mujer Exitosas (Successful Women's Bank).  At thirty year of age, she is the mother of two daughters, a 4 year old and a two year old, with whom she lives along with her life partner.  She is a very enterprising woman and has worked in various areas of commerce and service.  She has a lot of business experience.  Currently, she is working on the first steps of a micro-business of Choco-Bananos (frozen chocolate covered bananas), which consists of making and selling sweetened and filled bananas.  The business is a family business and she works with her mom and a sister-in-law who are also group members.

This is the second loan that the group has requested and the loan will be invested in the remodeling of a facility, to prepare it as a small "factory" as well as to purchase supplies, such as freezers and other necessary supplies.

Ileana has to work very hard to complete the orders that are already being requested.  She must get up at 3 in the morning in order to be able to work and also complete her household tasks, such as giving her daughters the care they require since they are very small.

She has many proposed goals and is determined to reach them.  Among these goals are consolidating her business and converting it into a factory with a presence in the market, improving the financial condition of her family and the quality of life, but above all, is being a successful micro-business and an example for her daughters and other women in her community, demonstrating that everything can be achieved with effort and hard work.

Along with Ileana, there are 7 other members of the group who also work in small industry and commerce.

loans.use: to remodel a facility as well as purchase supplies for a small factory.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
El señor Alejandro es de la ciudad de Villarrica, tiene 48 años de edad, está casado con la señora Liduvina de 46 años de edad. La pareja tiene 4  hijos, de los cuales 3 ya son mayores de edad, poseen sus actividades comerciales propias, y un menor de 14 años de edad, que es estudiante.
El señor Alejandro había empezado hace aproximadamente 10 años vendiendo de forma ambulante en la terminal de ómnibus todo tipo de artículos como quepis, lentes, billeteras y otros, hoy en día posee casilla propia de donde distribuye a los vendedores ambulantes todo tipo de productos. Comenta que con mucho sacrificio ha obtenido todo lo que tiene, y que el trabajo es el secreto de su éxito.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de anteojos, quepis, billeteras y demás productos, para surtir su casilla y de esa forma seguir progresando y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Alejandro, 48, lives in the city of Villarrica.  He and his wife, Liduvina, 46, have 4 children, three of whom are grown and have their own businesses.  Their youngest child, 14, is in school.  
Alejandro started working as a street vendor 10 years ago, working at the local bus station and selling all kinds of products: hats, eyewear, wallets, etc.  He started a distribution business next, opening a small shop and selling the kinds of products that street vendors want for their customers.  He says that he had to work very hard to build his business and that hard work is the secret to his success.
Alejandro is applying for a loan that he will use to buy eyewear, hats, wallets and the other products he needs to stock his business.  The investment will allow him to continue growing his business and helping his family.

loans.use: to stock his retail business.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es:
Claudio nació en la distrito de Ccatca de la provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco, él tiene 50 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos,  él es carpintero y tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde elabora todo tipo de muebles de madera como por ejemplo mesas, sillas, puertas, camas y otras cosas más. En esta oportunidad Claudio requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo maderas y clavos.  

Los socios del Banco Comunal “Mamacha Rosario” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Claudio was born in the Ccatca district in the province of Quispicanchis which is in the department of Cusco. He is 50 years old and he lives with his partner with whom he has three children. He is a carpenter and he has a small workshop in his home where he makes all types of wooden furniture such as tables, chairs, doors and beds among other things. At this time Claudio needs a loan to buy more work materials such as wood and nails.

The members of the Communal Bank "Mamacha Rosario" meet up every month in the Huancarani district of the province of Paucartambo, department of Cusco in Peru. Cusco is known for being a very touristic and commercial area because of the traditional Inti Raymi festival and also because one of the seven wonders of the world "Machupicchu" is located there.

loans.use: to buy more work material such as wood and nails.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan nació en la distrito de Caicay de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco y tiene 44 años de edad, él es carpintero y tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde fabrica todo tipo de muebles de madera como por ejemplo roperos, camas, sillas, mesas y otras cosas más, él tambien se dedica a  la venta de leña en su domicilio. En esta oportunidad Juan  requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo madera, cola de carpintero y clavos. 

Los socios del Banco Comunal “Mamacha Rosario” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Juan was born in the Caicay district in the Paucartambo province in the department of Cusco and he is 44 years old.  He is a carpenter and has a small workshop in his home where he makes all types of furniture, such as wardrobes, beds, chairs, tables, and other things.  He also works selling firewood from his home.  At this opportunity, Juan requires the loan to purchase more materials for his work, such as, wood, carpenter's glue and nails, for example.

The members of the communal bank "Mamacha Rosario" meet every thirty days in the Huancarani district in the Paucartambo province in the department of Cusco, Perú. Cusco is known for being a zone with a lot of tourism and commerce and for its traditional fiesta of Inti Raymi and because one of the seven wonders of the world “Machupicchu” is found there.

loans.use: to purchase more work materials such as wood, carpenter's glue and nails.

loans.name: Rosalbina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosalbina; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende diferentes tipos de productos como golosinas,gaseosas,aceites,arroz,azucar,leche entre otros,la socia llevabuen tiempo en estenegovcio el cual mediante este ella saca adelante  a su famailia,la socia trabaja todos los dias en este su negocio dese las 06:00am hasta las 10:00pm aproximadamnete,la socia es una persona bien alegre y responsable con muchas gansas de salir adelnate por su familia. 

La solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes como azucar,leche,golosinas entre otros,para de esta manera tener mas productos que ofrecer en su tienda.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                               La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rosalbina is a member of the “RICHARY ANTEÑA” communal bank located in Anta District belonging to Anta Province, Cusco Department.

She alternates her daily chores with running a grocery store. She sells different types of products like sweets, soft drinks, oil, rice, sugar, milk and noodles. She has spent a good amount of time in this business, which is how she gets her family ahead.  

She works in her business every day from 6:00 a.m. until approximately 10:00 p.m.  She is a very happy person with a great desire for her family to do well.

She is requesting the loan to buy products for her grocery store.  She will buy products like sugar, milk, and sweets, among others.  This way she will have more products to offer in her store.

She is happy with the loan and commits to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Conception

texts.en:
This is Conception, 29, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Joseph, a security guard, and mother of two children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.          

Conception operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also operates a small barber shop for additional income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 13,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Conception hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Sovan

texts.en: Sovan, 43, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well-known for its tourism sites (Angkor Wat temple, Banteay Srey temple, Bayon temple, etc.) She is a homemaker. Her husband is a construction foreman who approximately earns USD 9 per day. In order to improve her husband’s business, Savan is requesting for a loan of USD 500 to purchase more construction equipment for her husband to use in his construction work. In the future, she would like to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger and help her children get a Bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase more construction equipment for her husband to use in his construction work

loans.name: Selfina

texts.en:
Selfina is a 29-year-old farmer who is married to Demsy, a 30-year-old mini-van driver. Selfina and Demsy are blessed with three children, namely: Dino, 8 and attending 2nd grade of elementary school; Egi, 5, attending kindergarten; Risky, 1 year old.

Selfina has a paddy field. From this business she is able to earn income for her family. The income generated is spent on meals and children’s necessities. 

At the moment she needs money to buy fertilizer and pesticides. She has a little money but she should use it for Dino and Egi’s school fees.

Selfina got information that TLM can help her by providing a business loan for her business. She then submitted a loan application and requested a loan of IDR 7,000,000. She really hopes that TLM is willing to assist her through the loan.   


Note: When the picture was taken, Selfina was holding her son.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
This is Wilma, 46, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. As a single woman, she manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.                             

Wilma operates a school supplies business. It is where one can buy school supplies, like pens, bond paper, "cartolina" and the like, without going to a bookstore. She gets the supplies at wholesale prices and sells them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy school supplies to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Wilma hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of school supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Doleele Djiguen 8 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe de crédit Doleel Djiguène 8 regroupe des membres d’une même famille qui s’activent dans le commerce. Elles sont à leur deuxième crédit. L a photo, qui montre 4 d’entre elle fait apparaitre des visages souriants. La présidente, s’appelle Nogaye. Elle vend des tissus et des produits cosmétiques ; activité qu’elle exerce depuis plus de 15 ans. Avec les revenus de son commerce elle appui son mari dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne. Dans l’avenir, Nogaye aimerait ouvrir un magasin dans la ville avec un bon fond de roulement.
texts.en: The Doleel Djiguène 8 group is made up of people from the same family who are active traders. They are on their second loan. The photo, which shows four of them, reveals smiling faces. The president, whose name is Nogaye, sells fabrics and cosmetics, an activity which she has carried out for more than 15 years. With the income she makes from her business she helps her husband with the management of the daily expenses. In the future, Nogaye would like to open a shop in the town with a good working capital.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and cosmetics to sell on

loans.name: Antolin

texts.es:
Antolin nació en la distrito de MOSOC LLACTA de la provincia de Acomayo del departamento del Cusco y tiene 43 años de edad él es sastre y estudio alta costura en la ciudad de Lima, ahora él tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio(Huancarani, Paucartambo, Cusco) donde confecciona ropa y también hace compostura como por ejemplo subida de basta, entallado y cambio de sierre. En esta oportunidad Antolin requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo cierres, hilos y agujas.  

Los socios del Banco Comunal “Mamacha Rosario” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Antolin was born in the Mosoc Llacta district of Acomayo province in Cusco department. He is 43 years old and a tailor who studied fashion in the city of Lima. Now he has a small shop in his home (in Huancarani, Paucartambo, Cusco) where Antolin makes clothing and also, does mending and repairs, such as alterations of length or waist, and changing zippers. On this occasion, Antolin needs a loan to buy more work materials, for example zippers, thread and needles.

The members of the “Mamacha Rosario” Communal Bank gather every 30 days in Huancarani district, Paucartambo district, Cusco department. Cusco is well-known as a tourist and commercial zone, and for its traditional Inti Raymi fiesta, and also because it includes one of the seven wonders of the world, “Machupicchu.”

loans.use: buy tailoring materials, such as zippers, thread and needles.

loans.name: Elena Emperatriz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elena Emperatriz; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales como chanchos,la socia cria a estos animalitos para luego venderlos en las diferentes ferias que se realiza en Anta especialmente los dias viernes,la socia es una persona bien alegre y resposanble con muhas ganas de salir adelante por su familia siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia . 

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales y para comprar comida como verduras y alimento balanceado.  
                                                    
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “RICHARY ANTEÑA” communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Anta, which belongs to the province of Anta, department of Cuzco. 

Her name is Elena Emperatriz. She alternates between other activities and her business raising animals such as pigs. She raises these animals to later sell them in the different fairs in Anta, especially on Fridays. She is a cheerful and responsible person who really wants to get ahead for her family. This is the way she gets her family ahead.  

This member is asking for the loan to buy animals and to buy food such as vegetables and balanced feed. 
                                                    
She is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments.

loans.use: To buy animals and animal feed.

loans.name: Margara

texts.es:
Margara nació en el distrito de Paucartambo  de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, ella tiene 39 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos. Margara vive en la ciudad de Huancarani de la provincia de Huancarani y donde realiza todo tipo de actividad, ella se dedica a la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria en la plaza principal de la ciudad de Huancarani, ella también se dedica a la venta de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el prestamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo arroz, azucar, fideos, aceite, carne y otras cosas. 

Margara pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

Los socios del Banco Comunal se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Margara was born in Paucartambo district in Paucartambo province, in the department of Cusco.  She is 39 years old, married, and has 4 children.  Margara lives in the city of Huancarani in Huancarani province, and this is also where she has her business.  She sells food from a stand in the main plaza of the city of Huancarani.  In addition, she raises small animals, such as guinea pigs.  She has had this business for a number of years, and it is going very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  At this time, she requests a loan to buy supplies such as: rice, sugar, noodles, cooking oil, meat and other products.

Margara belongs to the communal bank “Mamacha Rosario” in the Asociación Arariwa, and she is grateful for the opportunity provided through these means.  Furthermore, she is committed to making her payments according to the established schedule.

The members of her communal bank meet every 30 days in Huancarani district in the province of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco, Peru.  Cusco is known for being a city with a lot of tourism and commerce, for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, and because it is the gateway to one of the 7 Wonders of the World: Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food business

loans.name: Dukoranimbaraga / Rsy Group

texts.fr:
Théoneste fait partie du groupe Dukoranimbaraga/Rsy. Il a 66 ans, il est marie avec 4 enfants de 22 à 37 ans. Il a 3 personnes dans son charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Théoneste est agriculteur. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’agrandir les champs en achetant d’autres champs le riz. Dans les prochaines années, Théoneste voudrait être un grand agriculteur dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de scolarisés ses enfants.
texts.en:
Théoneste  is part of the Dukoranimbaraga/Rsy Group.  He is 66 years old, married, with four children between the ages of 22 and 37.  He looks after three people in addition to his children.  He attended school from age six through primary education.

Théoneste is a farmer.  This is his first loan cycle with ACB.  He is going to use this loan in order to purchase fertilizer and pay labor wages.

His plan for business growth is to increase the size of his fields and purchase additional plots of rice.  In the next few years, Théoneste would like to be a large farmer in the region.  With his profits he will provide school fees for his children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay labor wages.

loans.name: Gerakuntego / Kmby Group

texts.fr:
Rajabu fait partie du groupe Gerakuntego/Kmby Bgrm. Il a 36 ans, il est célibataire. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Rajabu est agriculture. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’agrandir les champs en achetant d’autres champs. Dans les prochaines années, Rajabu voudrait être un grand cultivateur dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’améliore le niveau de manger de sa famille.
texts.en:
Rajabu is part of the Gerakuntego/Kmby Bgrm group. He is 36 years old and single. He has six years of primary education.

Rajabu is a farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB and he is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers and to pay for labor.

His strategy for growing his business is to expand his fields by buying other fields. In the coming years, Rajabu would like to be a significant farmer in his region. With the profits he makes, he is planning to improve his family's nutrition.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: Shirley De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Shirley es una microempresaria que habita en Costa Rica en la provincia de Puntarenas,Golfito,Pavones, zona Sur del país; caracterizado por ser una de las zonas de país, con indices de desarrollo humano muy bajo,con grados de escolaridad y empleo remunerado con respecto a los demas zonas del país mas desfavorable; de allí que una de las alternativas para estas mujeres es crear sus propias fuentes de autoempleo, esta microempresa comienza con una propina que Shirley recibe cuando laboraba como salonera en un restaurante de un hotel en Golfito, es allí en este trabajo donde comienza a vender mercadería de catálogo, tales como ropa, cosmeticos ete, deja este trabajo al darse cuenta que era una buena alternativa para poder estar cerca de sus hijos, y poder generar un ingreso que le permitiera ofrecer calidad de vida a su familia.
Ademas de la manutención de sus hijos, tiene a su cargo la responsabilidad de una hermana, quien al morir su madre queda esta niña a su cuidado, de tal forma que tiene una hija y su hermana de la misma edad, las cuales conviven bajo el mismo techo y por ende Shirley debe velar por ellos.
Este préstamo es importante para el deasrrollo de la actividad, ya que las casas proveedoras ofrecen un crédita a menos de un mes, lo que dificulta poder ofrecer un plazo mayor a sus clientas, lo que limita la expansión de su mercado, por esta limitación de capital.
texts.en:
Shirley is an entrepreneur who lives in Costa Rica, in the province of Puntarenas, Golfito, Pavones in the south of the country. It is known for being an area of the country with low rates of human development and compared to other areas of the country it has the most unfavorable rates of education and pay. Therefore one of the alternatives for these women is to develop their own sources of self-employment. This business began with a tip that Shirley received when she worked as a waitress in the restaurant of a hotel in Golfito. It was in that job that she began to sell mail order merchandise such as clothes and cosmetics. She left this job when she realised that it was a good alternative that allowed her to be close to her children and to earn an income that meant she could provide her family with a good quality of life.

Apart from the maintenance of her children, she is also responsible for her sister who was left in her care when her mother died. Her daughter and her sister are the same age and they live together under the same roof and Shirley must therefore watch over them.

The loan is important for the development of her job as the suppliers only offer credit facilities of less than one month which means it is difficult for her to offer longer credit terms to her customers. This limits the expanding of the market, due to her financial limitations.

loans.use: to buy mail order merchandise such as perfume, clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efraín nació en la distrito de Kosñipata de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco y tiene 34 años de edad él es carpintero y tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde fabrica muebles de madera como por ejemplo sillas, mesas, roperos, camas y otras cosas más. En esta oportunidad Efraín requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo madera, clavos, pintura y otras cosas más.   

Los socios del Banco Comunal “Mamacha Rosario” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Efraín was born in the district of Kosñipata, province of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco.  He is 34 and a carpenter.  He has a small workshop at home, where he makes wooden furniture, such as chairs, tables, cupboard, and beds.  At the moment, Efraín needs a loan to buy more work material, such as wood, nails, paint, and so on.

The members of the “Mamacha Rosario” community bank meet every 30 days in the district of Huancarani, province of Paucartambo, department of Cusco, Peru. Cusco is known as a tourist and business area and for its traditional Inti Raymi festival.  One of the seven wonders of the world, Macchu Picchu, is located nearby.

loans.use: to buy work materials, such as wood, nails, paint, and so on.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen es una madre de familia muy responsable de 43 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, vive en domicilio propio el cual esta ubicado en la calle Miguel Grau ubicado en el Distrito de Jayanca perteneciente a la Provincia de Lambayeque de donde se estima una distancia aproximada de 1 hora.

Su principal actividad económica de Carmen es dedicarse a la compra venta de productos de primera necesidad (bodega), la cual esta instalada en su propio domicilio y atiende personalmente, son 5 años los que ya viene  desempeñándose en la actividad y de los cuales ha sabido manejar por lo que ha generado sus ingresos con los que viven a diario, pero siempre con la idea de seguir creciendo para el mejoramiento de su calidad de vida.

Carmen por ahora esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1200 Nuevos Soles los cuales invertirá en el aumento de su capital de trabajo comprando mas abarrotes y variedad de productos de primera necesidad para brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes quienes ya están fidelizados por la buena atención brindada por parte de Carmen.
texts.en:
Carmen is a very responsible 43 year year old wife and mother. She has 2 children who are already grown. She lives in her own home located on Miguel Grau street in the district of Jayanca, which belongs to the province of Lambayeque, about an hour away.

Carmen's main economic activity is buying and selling basic necessity products in a store that is set up in her own house. She attends to it personally. She has been doing this job for 5 years and she knows how to manage it because she has generated the income they live on every day. She always has the idea to keep growing to improve her quality of life. 

Carmen is now asking for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the amount of 1200 Nuevos Soles. She will invest them in increasing her working capital by buying more food items and a variety of basic necessity products to offer her customers better service. They are already faithful to her because of the good service that Carmen gives.

loans.use: to buy food items and a variety of basic necessity products.

loans.name: Twitezimbere/ Gshsh Group

texts.fr:
Léo fait partie du groupe Twitezimbere/Gshsh. Il a 50 ans, il est marie avec 6 enfants de 6 à 20 ans dont 6 enfants sont scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Léo est agriculteur. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des semences sélectionne. Dans les prochaines années, Léo voudrait être un grand agriculteur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de scolariser et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Léo is part of the Twitezimbere/Gshsh Group.  He is 50 years old, married with six children between the ages of 6 and 20.  All six children are in school.  He has six years of primary school education.

Léo is a farmer.  This is his first loan cycle with ACB.  He is going to use this loan to purchase fertilizer and pay labor wages.

Hi business growth plan is to use the best seed.  In the coming years, Léo would like to be a large-scale rice farmer in the region.  With his profits, he will provide for care and school fees for his children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay labor wages.

loans.name: Ejoheza Munyarwanda Group

texts.fr:
Saleh fait partie du groupe Ejoheza Munyarwanda. Il a 30 ans, il est marie avec 2 enfants de 3 mois à 7 ans dont 1 enfant scolarise. Il a 2 personnes dans son charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 5 ans de primaire.

Saleh est agriculteur. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des semences sélectionne. Dans les prochaines années, Saleh voudrait avoir une maison des stocks de riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit de scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Saleh is part of the Ejoheza Munyarwanda Group.  He is 30 years old, married with two children, one 3 months and 7 years old.  One of his children is in school.  He cares for two other children in addition to his own. He has five years of primary school education.

Saleh is a farmer.  This is his first loan cycle with ACB.  He is going to use this loan to purchase fertilizer and pay labor wages.

Hi business growth plan is to use the best seed.  In the coming years, Saleh would like to have a house and a stockpile of rice.  With his profits, he will provide school fees for his children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay labor wages.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Canadá Group

texts.es:
Carmen Zuñiga, 44 años, casada, su actividad es el comercio. Ella se dedica a confeccionar y vender ropa para personas de todas las edades. Doña Carmen sin ayuda de nadie logra ofrecer su mercadería.
Desea el dinero para invertir en materia prima y también para comprarse una máquina de coser porque la que tiene ya esta muy vieja. Esto la ayudara en su negocio porque podrá confeccionar un mejor producto para sus clientes. Ella aprendió a coser desde sus dieciséis años pero hasta hace cuatro años se dedica a vender sus creaciones y obtiene buenos resultados, desea el crédito para surgir como mujer micro empresaria. 
Doña Carmen eligió Fundación Mujer porque ofrece crédito ágil, bueno y muy necesario para poder superarse.
texts.en:
Carmen Zuñiga is 44 years old, married, and works in commerce. She makes clothes for a living and sells clothing for people of all ages. Carmen, without anyone's help, has managed to offer her own merchandise. She wants the money to put towards raw materials and also to buy a sewing machine, because the one she has is very old. This will help her in her business because she will be able to make better products for her customers. 

She learned to sew at 16 but has been selling her creations for four years, which is working out well. She wants the loan to be able to get ahead as a woman with her small business. 

Carmen chose the Woman Foundation because is offers quick, good, and very necessary loans so that she can move forward.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gladys;La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de frutas como manzanas, naranjas, platanos entre otras frutas, ella vende de forma ambulatoria , a la vez la socia se dedica  al negocio de venta de salchipapas ella vende por la noche cerca a su casa, la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de frutas. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar frutas al por mayor como piñas,papayas y platanos.
                                                        
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The bank member is a part of the 'Richary Anteña' communal bank; The bank is located in the district of Anta, which is a part of the province of Anta, department of Cusco. 

The bank member is Gladys. She alternates her daily activities between selling fruits like apples, oranges, plantains and other fruits, selling in the street and she also has a business selling 'salchipapas' (a traditional snack made of thinly sliced pan fried beef mixed with french fries and served with sauce), which she sells at night close to her house. It is as a result of these businesses that she has been able to help her children get ahead. She would like to increase her fruit selling business.

She is requesting a loan to buy fruit at wholesale price, like pineapples, papayas and plantains. 

She is happy for the loan and she promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy fruit at wholesale, like pineapples, papayas and plantains.

loans.name: Abatabazi/cyrkr Group

texts.fr:
Benjamin fait partie du groupe Abatabazi/Cyrkr. Il a 50 ans, il est marie avec 5 enfants de 12 à 14 ans, dont 3 enfants scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 5 ans de primaire.

Benjamin est agriculteur. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des engrais chimique sélectionne. Dans les prochaines années, Benjamin voudrait être un grand cultivateur de riz dans le pays. Avec les profits, il prévoit de scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Benjamin is part of the Abatabazi/Cyrkr Group.  He is 50 years old, married with five children between the ages of 12 and 14, of whome three are in school. He has five years of primary school education.

Benjamin is a farmer.  This is his first loan cycle with ACB.  He is going to use this loan to purchase fertilizer and pay labor wages.

Hi business growth plan is to use the best seed and fertilizers.  In the coming years, Benjamin would like to be a large-scale rice farmer in the region.  With his profits, he will provide school fees for his children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay labor wages.

loans.name: Abishyizehamwe - Cite Group

texts.fr:
Masumbuko fait partie du groupe Abashyizehamwe. Il a 52 ans, il est marie avec 6 enfants de 5 à 26 ans, dont 3 ont scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Masumbuko est agriculteur. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des engrais chimique sélectionne. Dans les prochaines années, Masumbuko voudrait acheter des machines pour moderniser son agriculture. Avec les profits, il prévoit de scolariser, soigner et améliorer le niveau de manger de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Masumbuko is part of the Abashyizehamwe Group.  He is 52 years old, married, with six children between the ages of 5 and 26, of whom three are in school. He has six years of primary school education.

Masumbuko is a farmer.  This is his first loan cycle with ACB.  He is going to use this loan to purchase fertilizer and pay labor wages.

Hi business growth plan is to use the best fertilizers.  In the coming years, Masumbuko would like to purchase equipment to modernize his farming practices.  With his profits, he will provide school fees for his children, care for them and improve their nutrition.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay labor wages.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Debora Group

texts.es:
Este Banco mujer se constituyo en el año 2007, desarrollan sus actividades productivas en Costa Rica, el la provincia de Puntarenas, en el cantón de Corredores, en el distrito de Paso Canoas, en la frontera Sur de Costa Rica; durante la permanencia en el programa de servicios financieros de Fundación Mujer, se les ha apoyado en cuatro oprtunidades, siempre se han caracterizado por tener una muy buena moral de pago, ademas en esta oportunidad unicamente no participara una de sus miembras por estar embarazada y considerar que este estado puede presentale dificultades para el desarrollo de su actividad, demostrandose con ello que es una mujer responsable, que no desea poner en aprietos a las demas compañeras cuando toque realizar el pago; dentro de este Banco mujer, existen mujeres que la actividad es la única fuente de ingresos, y en otros casos los ingresos generados se convierten en un aporte importantisimo para la económía domestica, ya que en la zona donde habitan existen pocas fuentes remuneradas y por la edad que tienen la mayoria de las integrantes, no tienen la posibilidad de poder optar a estas fuentes de trabajo.
El dinero como en los préstamos anteriores se destinara a la compara de mercancias de catálogo para la reventa, estos créditos les permiten poder ofrecer crédito a sus clientas, con lo cual se aumentan las oportunidades de hacer negocios.
texts.en:
This women's bank formed in 2007 and is active in Costa Rica, in the province of Puntarenas, in the municipality of Corredores, which is in the Paso Canoas district, on Costa Rica's southern frontier.  During the period in which it has participated in the financial services program of the Fundación Mujer (Women's Foundation), it has received support four times and has always been very good about meeting payments.  This time around, one of its members is not involved because she is pregnant and believes that it might be difficult for her to work during this funding cycle.  This shows what a responsible woman she is, who does not want to cause problems for her comrades when it comes time to pay.  For some of the members of this women's bank, their work is their only source of income, while for others, the money generated constitutes a very important part of the household income because in the area where they live, there are very few paid sources of income and because the age of most of the women who are members means they are not able to access what few sources of work do exist.

As with the previous loans, the money they will receive will go to buy resale merchandise from a catalogue; the Kiva credit will allow them to offer credit to their clients, which will increase their opportunities to make sales.

loans.use: to buy merchandise from a catalogue, such as cosmetics, perfumes, and clothing.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is 26 years old and supports one person in his family. He owns a primary school where he has been for three years. The business is doing well.
 
He has requested a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase materials for construction of more classrooms. The profit from his business will help him repay his loan and expand the school. 

He hopes to excel in his business as well as his family. This is his first loan.

loans.use: to purchase materials for construction of more classrooms.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 34 years old. She is married to Paul and is blessed with two children, ages 12 and 8 years respectively. She has a dairy where she sells milk. She started the business ten years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

She has requested a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase a dairy cow. The anticipated profit will be used to improve her business.  She hopes to succeed in her business. This is her second loan.

loans.use: to purchase a  dairy cow.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia nació en el distrito de Kosñipata de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, ella tiene 35 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo. Celia vive en la ciudad de Huancarani de la provincia de Huancarani y donde realiza todo tipo de actividad, ella trabaja en el PRONEI (Programa Nacional de Educación Inicial) como ayudante, ella también se dedica a la cosechar,  cultivar y vender cereales como por ejemplo trigo, cebada, moraya seca, maíz y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

En esta oportunidad Celia requiere el préstamo para compra semillas de cereales. Celia pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

Los socios del Banco Comunal se reúnen cada treinta en el distrito de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Celia was born in the district of Kosñipata in the province of Paucartambo, department of Cuzco. She is 35 years old and is in a common law marriage, from which she has one son. Celia lives in the city of Huancarani in the province of Huancarani, where she does all types of activities. She works in PRONEI (Programa Nacional de Educación Inicial) as an assistant. She also grows, harvests and sells grains, for example wheat, barley, dried moraya, corn and others. She has had this business for several years and it is going very well for her thanks to the hard work she puts into her work.   

At this time, Celia requires the loan to buy grain seeds. Celia belongs to the “Mamacha Rosario” communal bank of the Asociación Arariwa and she is grateful for the opportunity offered in this way and is committed to making her payments according to schedule. 

The members of the communal bank meet every month in the  Banco district of Huancarani of the province of Paucartambo in the department of Cuzco, Peru. Cuzco is known for being popular with tourists and for having a lot of commerce. It is also known for its traditional festival called Inti Raymi, and because in it is one of the seven wonders of the world  “Machupicchu”.

loans.use: to buy grain seeds.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria nació en el distrito de Kosñipata de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, ella tiene 44 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene seis hijos. Victoria vive en la ciudad de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo y donde realiza todo tipo de actividad, ella se dedica a la venta de combustible y venta de artefactos como por ejemplo radios, televisores, planchas y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

En esta oportunidad Victoria requiere el préstamo para comprar más artefactos. Victoria pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

Los socios del Banco Comunal se reúnen cada treinta en el distrito de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Csuco, Perú. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Victoria was born in the district of Kosñipata, in the province of Paucartambo which is a part of the department of Cusco. She is 44 years old and is in a common law marriage, from which she has six children. Victoria lives in the city of Huancarani, in the province of Paucartambo and it is also where she has her business. She makes a living selling gas and small electrical appliances like radios, televisions and irons as well as other things. She has had this business for a few years and she is doing very well thanks to the determination with which she works. 

Victoria is requesting a loan to be able to buy more small appliances. She is a member of 'Mamacha Rosario' communal bank, of the association 'Arariwa'. She is thankful for the opportunity provided in this form and she agrees to comply with the payments as set up in the schedule. 

The members of the communal bank meet once a month in the district of Huancarani, which is in the province of Paucartambo and the department of Cusco, Cusco is well known for being a tourist area, a commercial district, for it's traditional celebration of 'Inti Raymi' (Festival of the Sun: a religious ceremony of the Inca Empire in honoring the god Inti, one of the most venerated gods in the Inca religion.) and because it contains one of the seven wonders of the world, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy more small electrical appliances.

loans.name: Py Renda Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo a través de dos de las miembros, quienes se habían acercado hasta la Oficina de la Fundación Paraguaya para interiorizarse más al respecto del  Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, ellas invitaron a sus amigas y compañeras de Barrio y decidieron sumarse al trabajo grupal para salir adelante y así mejorar sus estilos de vida. Son 19 mujeres trabajadoras y humildes que deben ganarse el sustento todos los días.
Romelia es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora y comenta que por medio de la venta de prendas que hace, ha podido salir adelante y de esa forma poder ayudar a su familia. Ella comenta que su sueño es poder tener un gran local donde poder abastecer a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de remeras, camisas, pantalones y demás tipo de prendas, con las cuales podrá abastecerse y tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee was formed by two of its members who approached the offices of the Fundación Paraguaya to learn more about the Committee of Entrepreneurial Women program. They invited their friends and neighbors to join and together they decided to form the work group in order to get ahead and improve their way of life. They are made up of 19 hardworking and modest women who have to earn a living for themselves everyday. 

Romelia is a very hardworking and determined woman. She says that by selling clothes she has been able to get ahead in life and therefore help her family. She says that her dream is to have a big premises where she can supply her customers. She is requesting the loan to buy t-shirts, shirts, pants and other kinds of clothes so that she can stock up and offer her customers more choice.

loans.use: to buy clothes to subsequently sell on.

loans.name: Roise

texts.en:
Roise is 44 years old. She is married to Josphat and together they have two children. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past seven years.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to purchase farm inputs and potato seedlings.

In the future, Roise hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu area.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and potato seedlings.

loans.name: Josepheline

texts.en:
Josephine, age 39, has been selling rice, beans, sugar, and oil for the past  six years. She was taught how to run the business by a friend. Her main challenges are the increases in prices. She takes pleasure from her work and is happy when her efforts produce more profit.

She lives in Gardnersville with her husband, who is a carpenter, and their four children, ages five to 17. All the children live at home and three of them are attending school.
 
She’s requesting a loan in order to purchase and sell more rice, oil, beans, and sugar to offer for sale. She would like to increase the size of her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, beans, and sugar to offer for sale

loans.name: Bishop

texts.en:
Bishop, age 30, owns and operates a barber shop in Voi. He is the married father of two children. He has been running this business for the past four years with considerable success. 

This marks Bishop's first business loan from KADET Ltd. He plans to purchase new shaving machines and to renovate his shop. He will use the anticipated profits to open a new business and to ensure the education of his children. 

He hopes to own many barbershops in Voi.

loans.use: to purchase new shaving machines and to renovate his shop

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es:
La señora Rafaela tiene 48 años,  está casada hace 30 años con el señor Mercenio de 54 años de edad, el matrimonio tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales dos vive en forma independiente y los otro dos viven con su padre.
La Sra. Rafaela se dedica a la confección de ropas desde hace 21 años, realiza trabajo sobre medida y también al por mayor para uniformes de escuelas,  conjunto de buzos, remeras, su marido es macatero y recorre los barrios de la ciudad en una motocicleta y juntos se ayudan a llevar adelante los gastos familiares.
Solicita este préstamo para la compra de telas, cierres, hilos, botones, gomas, y otros artículos que le permitirá ofrecer variedad  a sus clientes y así poder mejorar su ingreso mensuales.-
texts.en:
Rafaela, 48, has been married for 30 years to Mercenio, 54.  The couple has four children, two of whom live on their own, the other two with their parents.

Rafaela has worked making clothing for 21 years.  She does custom work as well as wholesale jobs for school uniforms, track suits, and t-shirts.  Her husband is a street vendor and travels throughout all the neighborhoods in the city on a motorcycle.  Together they help each other carry through with the family expenses.

She is requesting this loan to buy fabric, zippers, thread, buttons, elastic, and other articles that will allow her to offer her clients variety and so be able to improve her monthly income.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es:
Doña Isabel, cuenta con dos trabajos, cocinera de un colegio y venta de ropa, cosmetico, en donde logra captar sus cliente en el mismo trabajo, lo que se ha venido ayudando al tener un ingreso fijo y sus ventas variadas. Siendo madre soltera de tres hijos estudiantes.
Sus financiamientos han sido para mantener su inversion, con este nuevo prestamo comprara: ropa de damas, niños y varones, el cual tiene encargos de pedidos, asi como mantener al cliente sastifecho, mejores ganancias que ayude a mejorar la canasta basica, y pagos de gastos basicos y asi poder dar lo necesario a sus hijos. Al poder tener mejores ventas.
texts.en:
Isabel has two jobs. She is a cook at a school. She also sells clothing and cosmetics and she is able to attract customers at her job. This work has been helping her to have a fixed income and varied sales. She is a single mother to three school age children.
Her funding has been use for maintaining her investment. With this new loan, she will buy women’s, children’s and men’s clothing. She takes orders and therefore keeps her customers satisfied. Better profits help her with improving the basic family shopping basket and with making basic expenses payments. With this help, she can give what is necessary to her children. She wants to have better sales.

loans.use: invest in women’s, children’s and men’s clothing in order to increase her sales.

loans.name: Petience

texts.en:
Patience lives in Gardnersville. She is 29 years old and single with two children, ages 7 and 9. Both children live at home and attend school.

For the past 14 years, she has been operating a cook shop (restaurant). She learned this way of selling from her mother and started her business with money given to her by her mother. She enjoys a good flow of customers and the profit she receives each day. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, vita, salt, pepper, oil and onion for her business. In the future, she wants to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, vita, salt, pepper, oil and onion for her business.

loans.name: Ñemityra Group

texts.es:
El comité “Ñemityra´´, se conformo con la iniciativa de la señora Buenaventura, ellas son mujeres indígenas que forman parte de una comunidad de la ciudad de Villa Ygatimi. Actualmente se encuentran en el primer ciclo, con once integrantes, estas mujeres gracias a la oportunidad que están recibiendo de la fundación, han podido emprender una actividad y ayudar a sus familias.
Buenaventura es la presidenta del grupo, y nos comenta que se dedica a la cría de animales, como ser gallinas, cerdos, cabras y demás tipos de animales. Cuenta que es un trabajo muy sacrificado, que requiere de mucho esfuerzo, no solo físico, sino también mental. Ella está muy contenta con lo que está haciendo, por que sabe que gracias a este trabajo ayudará a su familia.
Buenaventura solicita el crédito para la compra de alimentos para los animales que cría, pues no quiere quedarse sin stock.
texts.en:
The committee "Ñemityra" was formed from the initiative of Señora Buenaventura. They are indigenous women who make up part of a community in the city of Villa Ygatimi. They are currently in their first loan cycle. There are eleven members and thanks to the opportunity that they have received from the foundation, these women have been able to launch a business and help their families.

Buenaventura is the president of the group and she tells us that she breeds animals for a living, such as hens, pigs, goats and other kinds of animals. She says that it is a very difficult job and that it requires a lot of strength - not just physical but also mental. She is very happy with what she is doing because she knows that thanks to this job she will help her family.

Buenaventura is requesting the loan to buy food for the animals she is breeding because she does not want to be left without stock.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
El comité “Primavera” es un comité formado en el mes de enero, actualmente están en Primer ciclo  y comentan que están muy contentas con la ayuda de la fundación. Con las capacitaciones y asesoramiento que se les da la ahora están haciendo ferias de comidas para que puedan pagar la cuota y a la vez tener un poco de ahorros.
Ninfa nos comenta que tiene una despensa, con la cual surte a sus vecinos del barrio. Cuenta que con mucho sacrificio ha logrado salir adelante, ya que había empezado con un pequeño local, que gracias al esfuerzo y trabajo que le pone ha logrado ampliarlo.
Ella solicita el crédito para surtir su negocio con harina, azúcar, fideos, enlatados, carnes y demás artículos de primera necesidad, con lo cual podrá cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Primavera communal bank was formed in the month of January.  Currently they are in the first loan cycle and they comment that they are very happy with the foundation's help.  With the training and advice they are given, now they are having food markets so they can make their payments and at the same time have a bit of savings.

Ninfa tells us that she has a store with which she supplies her neighbors in the neighborhood.  She says that she has managed to get ahead with great sacrifice, because she had begun with a small space that she managed to expand thanks to the effort and work she puts into it.

She is requesting the loan to supply her business with flour, sugar, noodles, canned goods, meat, and other basic household necessities with which she will be able to fulfill customer demand.

loans.use: to buy basic household necessities for her store.

loans.name: Dupharo

texts.en:
Dupharo, age 32, owns and operates a retail shop where he sells a variety of goods. He has worked in his business for three years and sells primarily to locals and passers-by. He earns an additional income from a motorcycle business. He and his wife have two children between the ages of eight and and 10, two of whom are enrolled in school. Dupharo's highest monthly expense is food for his family. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Dupharo will use the Kes 30,000 loan to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, and kerosene. Dupharo aspires toward establishing a wholesale shop in the future. He has joined Yehu to access capital in order to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, and kerosene to offer for sale in his shop.

loans.name: Francisco Hildebrando

texts.es:
El señor Francisco sigue, trabajando en mantenimiento de construccion, pues tiene contrato con empresas, siendo fijos sus ingresos, el cual le ha permitido seguir mejorando su vivienda, y apoyando a sus hijos.
Es a traves del financiamiento que ha avanzado mas rapido, con este nuevo prestamo construira el baño e inodoro, asi como un bajarete en frente de la casa, ya que le es de gran relevancia, en la higiene y seguridad de su familia. logrando sastifaccion al hacer posible sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Francisco works in construction maintenance.  Since he has a contract with companies, he receives a fixed income, which has allowed him to keep improving his home and support his children.

Taking out loans has enabled Francisco to move forward more quickly.  He plans to use his new loan to construct a bathroom with a flush toilet, along with a screened-in porch in front of the house.  These improvements will be very important for his family’s hygiene and security.  Francisco is happy that the loan will make it possible to carry out these projects.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for building a bathroom with a flush toilet.

loans.name: Kairykul

texts.ru: Кайыркул 45 лет, вдова, имеет троих детей, младший из которых дошкольного возраста. Кайыркул проработала преподавателем математики в школе,  но после смерти мужа в 2008 году, в поисках источника финансирования для своей семьи, начала свой бизнес в животноводстве со стартовой суммой 25,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Кайыркул, на сегодня  ее хозяйство с 3 бычками и 1 коровой приносит около 13,000 сом в месяц от продажи молока, молочных и мясных продуктов.  Доходы от бизнес – деятельности позволяют Кайыркул оплачивать обучение сына в Юридической академии. Для дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, Кайыркул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы Кайыркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства.
texts.en: Kairykul is 45 years old. She is a widow with three children, the youngest of whom is still of preschool age. Kairykul worked as a math teacher in secondary school for a long time, but after her husband’s death in 2008, searching for an income source for her family, she launched her livestock business, with a starting capital of 25,000 KGS. Thanks to Kairykul’s hard work, her farm, which now counts three calves and a cow, brings in about 13,000 KGS a month from the sales of milk as well as dairy and meat products. The revenues from her business allow Kairykul to pay for her son’s law school studies. In order to grow her business further, Kairykul turned to “Bai Tushum & Parnters” for a loan in the amount of 120,000 KGS in order to buy calves for fattening and later resale. Kairykul plans to invest her revenues into expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane's group is comprised of five hard-working women. Jane is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala west region of Uganda where, for the past year, she has been working hard to manage her small market, which sells vegetables.

To help expand her business, Jane has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more vegetebles for resale, which will help her to generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. Jane hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land.

Jane is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Jane's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetebles for resale,

loans.name: Kemoh V.o.'s Group

texts.en:
Presented to you in the photo above are primary school teachers from Koidu, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org., to apply for a loan. Because teachers’ salaries are usually small, they go to SMT for loans to buy or invest in things that their salaries cannot cover. At the end of each month, they repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. Their bursar is directly responsible for making the repayment on their behalf.

The leader of this group of teachers is Kemoh. Born in Kailahun, located in Eastern Sierra Leone, the 54-year-old is married to a teacher, and the couple has four children, one in primary school, one in secondary, and two in college. Kemoh has been a teacher for 26 years now and has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Muthusi

texts.en:
Muthusi is a chemist who lives in Malindi area of Coast province, Kenya.  He has been operating his chemist business for four years. He started off the business from his personal savings. He is married.

He was introduced to Milango by his friends and joined the institution to access credit for his business. Muthusi is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to purchase more medications.

The challenge facing the business is high cost of stock, inflation, and high fees paid to the government. Despite all these, Muthusi would like to open a testing laboratory in future.

loans.use: to purchase more medications

loans.name: Kahindi

texts.en:
Kahindi, age 25, operates a boda boda (motorcycle) transportation business. He also sells goods from door to door. He has worked in this business for three years. His primary customers are locals and passers-by. He describes his greatest business challenge to be seasonality.

Kahindi lives with his wife Sidi and their three small children: the youngest is a two-month-old baby, and the eldest is five years old and enrolled in school.  Kahindi's highest monthly expense is food for the family. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Sidi works as a charcoal vendor.

Kahindi joined Yehu in order to access capital, and he will use the Kes 30,000 loan to service his motorcycle and to boost his wife's charcoal business. Kahindi aspires to start a livestock business in the future.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle and to boost his wife's charcoal business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a bull

loans.name: Sylvia's Group

texts.en:
Sylvia's group is comprised of 3 hard working women. Sylvia is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years, Sylvia has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells snacks. 

To help expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy cooking oil and flour, and will help Sylvia to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Sylvia hopes that in the future she will be able to start selling clothes. 

Sylvia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Sylvia's future prospects by helping her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil and flour,

loans.name: Ronah

texts.en:
Ronah, age 21, is a member of a group of hard-working women. Ronah earns an income by making and selling bread. She lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala west region of Uganda. For the past four years, Ronah has been working hard to manage her small business.

To help expand her business, Ronah has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more flour for making bread, and will help Ronah to generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. Ronah hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Ronah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Ronah's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more flour for making and selling bread

loans.name: Felecial

texts.en: Felecial is 34 years old and lives in Gardnersville.  She is married.  She had to stop her education in 12th grade. For the past seven years Felecial has been selling  charcoal the market to sustain herself. She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal to expand her business. Felecial's dream is to become a international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to  expand her business

loans.name: El Sol (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Sol está formado por 4 socias y 2 socios, quienes se caracterizan por el carisma y la cordialidad, laboran diariamente en diferentes actividades  las mismas que les permiten aportar la economía de sus hogares. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por ser desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, la variedad de su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Rosa, tiene 65 años de edad, es viuda y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 10 hijos de los cuales 8 son casados y viven independientes y sus dos hijos solteros trabajan y estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Rosa es comerciante de carnes y también tiene una picantería (restaurante) donde prepara platos de comida típica, labora en esta actividad hace 20 años.

Se encuentra en el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para prepara la comida y carne para la venta.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The El Sol communal bank is made up of 4 female and 2 male members, who are noted for their warmth and charisma.  They are involved in different economic activities that allow them to support their households.  The members live in different parts of the city of Cuenca.  The city was recognized as a UNESCO World Heritage Site in December 1999.  Its residents maintain their culture and traditions, and the variety of its cuisine captivates the palates of locals and foreigners alike.

One of the members of the group is Rosa.  She is 65 years old, widowed, and has 10 children from that relationship.  8 of her children are married and live independently, while 2 of her children are single and study at a school in the city.  Rosa does not have her own house, but lives in a rented residence.

Rosa sells meat, and also has a ‘picantería’ (restaurant) where she prepares traditional dishes.  She has worked in this business for 20 years.

This is Rosa’s second loan with her communal bank, and she will use it to purchase supplies for preparing meals at her restaurant along with meat to sell.

Rosa’s dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for preparing meals and meat to sell.

loans.name: Faiza

texts.en:
Faiza, age 24, operates a bicycle spare parts business. She sells her goods at the market and has worked in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals. 

She joined Yehu to access capital in order to benefit her business, and she will use the Kes 50,000 loan to purchase rims, spokes, and tires. 

She and her husband Selim, who is employed as a public servant, own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. They have two children: one is an eight-month-old baby and one is three years old. The eldest is enrolled in school.

Faiza aspires toward expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase rims, spokes, and tires

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher has operated his retail shop in Nakuru town for the last two years.  He is 36 years old, separated, and has one child.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of soaps, wheat flour and washing detergent for sale in his retail shop.

In the future, Christopher hopes to grow his retail shop to a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soaps, wheat flour and washing detergent for sale.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is a tailor who lives and works in Malindi, Kenya. She owns a tailoring shop that has been in operation for three years. She started up the business with the help of her parents’ savings. She is single and has no children.

Prisca became a member of Milango after hearing about it from friends. Her main challenges are price fluctuations, inflation, and tax, as well as the lack of capital to purchase stock. She is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy additional sewing machines.

The extra income expected to result from this loan will be saved to be used in case of emergency in the business and will assist her in her loan repayment. She aspires toward opening a boutique in future.

loans.use: to buy additional sewing machines for her tailoring business

loans.name: Sahr E.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleases to present to you this group of primary school teachers from Koidu city in Eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan. SMT/Kiva loans designed for teachers have proven to be very helpful to teachers. Usually, teachers’ salaries are small, making it impossible to invest in anything great. But with the help of these loans, they are now in positions to buy or invest in bigger things, and at the end of each month they repay the loan using their salaries. 

Sahr is the leader of this group of borrowers. The 45 year old is a native of Ngandorhun village in Eastern Sierra Leone. A husband and a father of 2 children who are attending primary and secondary school, Sahr has been a teacher for 14 years now. With the help of this loan, he is going to buy house building materials – iron corrugated zinc sheets, sand, nails, cement, etc. - for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials - iron corrugated zinc sheets, sand, nails, cement, etc. - for the construction of a dwelling house

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman. She has 5 children. Her husband's name is Tsuma and he works as a farmer. Chizi operates a cereals-selling business and sells her goods in a shop. Her primary customers are passersby and neighbours. Chizi's other source of income includes her husband's income.  Her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.
