Currently, Anabel is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the amount of 1,800 new "soles" with which she wishes to buy balanced feed to fatten and grow her animals faster and to offer them at a better price.

Despite being very young, she has demonstrated to be entrepreneurial and hard-working for the wellbeing of herself and her family.

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is 26 years old single lady and supports three members of her family. She is a freelance masseuse, a service she started offering five years ago, and she earns a monthly income of KES 6,000.

She has requested for a loan worth KES 5,000 to purchase massage lotions. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase massage lotions.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Mary Grace has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 14,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Mary Grace has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Mary Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 42 years old and lives in Landing, Baliangao. She is married with three children. Marilyn has a shop that sells groceries and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of 30,000 to purchase 10 cases of beverages and grocery items. Marilyn has been a member of PMPC for eight years.

loans.use: to purchase 10 cases of beverages and grocery items

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with 1 child. 

Josephine has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 13,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Josephine has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  

In the future, Josephine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for sale

loans.name: Yakob

texts.en:
Yakob is a 25-year-old single man who is living with his mother and a 5-year-old nephew. After graduating from high school seven years ago he decided to initiate a kiosk business. As the only son, Yakob is responsible for helping his mother generate income for their daily needs. He spent his own money to buy kiosk stocks. He sells daily-use basic items e.g., instant noodle, biscuits, sugar, coffee, shampoo, etc. 

Lately, Yakob is thinking of adding stock to his kiosk such as cigarettes, instant noodles, snacks, cooking oil, etc. as the more goods he sells then the more income he can earn.  He needs capital assistance to do so. 

He met a loan officer and received some information on the individual lending program provided by TLM. He then was interested in joining the program and requested a loan of 4,000,000 Rupiah (IDR). Yakob is hoping that TLM will approve his loan application soon.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory such as cigarettes, instant noodles, snacks, cooking oil, etc

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara, 42, is living with her husband Leonard, who is 45, and her daughter Titin, who is 16 and who is attending the second grade of senior high school. 

Sara has been running a kiosk business for three years. The income earned from this business enables her to help her husband in covering their living expenses. 

Currently Sara wants to improve her business by completing the stock at her kiosk. By selling more items at her kiosk she can generate more income. Therefore, Sara would like to request a loan of 3,000,000 Rupiah (IDR) from TLM. She will spend the loan on sugar, coffee, shampoo, bath soap, detergent, instant noodles, etc. 

She hopes that TLM is willing to assist her in improving her business by providing a business loan.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, coffee, shampoo, bath soap, detergent, instant noodle, etc.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 38 years old and married to Mercy who contributes to the family income. He has been running his scrap metal shop for a period of six years with an income of about KES. 5,000.


This is his fourth loan with KADET LTD, after successfully repaying the previous ones. He wants to use his loan to buy more scrap metals for manufacturing. He hopes to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To  buy more scrap metals for resale.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn is 31 years old and lives in Rosita Homes Mercedes Zamboanga City. She is married.

Ginalyn has a general store, a boarding house and a military supplies business and earns approximately 20,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase more products for her general store.

Ginalyn is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Ginalyn hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her general store

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela is 38 years old and lives in Landing, Baliangao. She is married with 3 children. 

To earn a living, Rosela has a business selling "puto" rice cakes. She earns about 3,200 PHP each month doing this type of work. Rosela has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase 1 sack of flour and other ingredients needed to make puto. Rosela has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase 1 sack of flour and other ingredients needed to make puto

loans.name: Jenefer

texts.en:
Jenefer is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Jenefer has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Jenefer has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  

In the future, Jenefer hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for sale

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en:
Arthur is a 53-year-old man from Homabay County, in West Kenya. He is married to Mary, and they have four children between 18 and 25. 

Arthur operates a mobile phone money transfer service locally known as M-PESA and has been doing this for the last nine years. He is taking his first loan from KADET Ltd. which he will use to add float to this business. 

He will use profits to repay the loan. He dreams of diversifying to dairy farming.

loans.use: To increase float of the money transfer business service.

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
This is Melody, 40, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Reynaldo, an employee, and she is a mother to her children. Melody, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Melody operates a cell phone retailing business. What she basically does is buy cell phone units from a supplier, then sells them with a little profit. Her products are mobile handsets. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional stocks of mobile and cell phone units to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Melody hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of cell phone units needed in her business

loans.name: Marivic Group

texts.en:
Marivic is 30 years old and lives in Magcamiguing, Calamba. She is widowed with one child. 

Marivic has a shop that sells grocery items. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to purchase additional stock: five boxes of grocery items. 

Marivic has been a member of PMPC for three years. 

Marivic is the leader of a two person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase 5 boxes of grocery items

loans.name: Abdel Nabi

texts.en:
Abdel Nabi is a 31-year-old Lebanese man who lives with his wife. He strives to work really hard in order to enrich their way of living and cover the heavy costs of life. 

Abdel Nabi began to work as a furniture painter in 2009 and now has twelve years of experience in this domain. He has gained different clients from different areas especially because of his good reputation and well organized work. 

Today, he's looking to take out a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new painting tools and improve his business. In the future, he plans to open his own furniture gallery.

loans.use: to purchase new painting tools and improve his business

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernadita is from Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is forty-four years old. Bernadita is married and has four children. 

To make a living, Bernadita runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home-use products such as candies, cigarettes, shampoo and soaps to the local community. Bernadita has been engaged in her business for over eleven years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Bernadita is requesting a loan of 18,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase stock to resell. In 2010, Bernadita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
This is Myrna, 49, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Danilo, a mechanic, and they have two children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 

Myrna operates a salon. She offers hair styling, hair grooming, manicure and pedicure, and the like. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy supplies for her salon like shampoo, hair treatment creams and oils, and other things needed for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Myrna dreams to be able to give her chilrend a high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and products needed in her business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Forty-seven-year-old Grace is married to Reuben and blessed with four children aged 26, 23, 20 and 17 years. She has a wholesale shop where she sells sacks, a business she started 28 years ago and from which she earns a monthly income of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). 

She has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to purchase 1,000 sacks. The profit earned from the business will help her repay her loan and improve her living standard. 

Her dream is to expand her business and build rental houses. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase 1,000 sacks.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a forty-five-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and four school-aged children. In order to live properly and be able to pay his children’s educational fees, Hasan works hard and nonstop. He’s an independent constructor specialized in floor covering and has been working in this domain since 1995. 

Today, he needs to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new construction tools for his business. He notes that this will facilitate his work and let him take on more projects without facing problems. In the future, he plans to renew his tools and take on bigger projects.

loans.use: to purchase new construction tools for his business.

loans.name: Nefisa

texts.en:
Nefisa is fifty-two years old, and married to Said who contributes to the family income. She has been selling clothes and textiles for a period of about two years with an income of about KES17,000.

This is her first loan with KADET Ltd. and she wants to use it to buy more textiles for her shop. She hopes to be a wholesaler and improve the family’s living standards.

loans.use: To purchase material for her shop.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a thirty-one-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and three working siblings. He and his siblings take care of his family, and they’re doing their best to enrich their way of living and cover the heavy costs of life. 

Ali began to work as a painter in 2002, and already has ten years of experience in this domain. He has his own loyal customers. Today, he’s seeking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new painting tools and brushes for his business. This will allow him to take on more projects thus earn superior income. In the future, he plans to open his own painting shop.

loans.use: to purchase new painting tools and brushes for his business.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is fifty-three years old and lives in Mauswagon, Calamba. She is married with eight children. 

To earn a living, Carmelita has a business selling dried fish. She earns about PHP 3,600 each month doing this type of work. Carmelita has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase more dried fish to sell.

Carmelita has been a member of PMPC for nine years.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
This is Mercedes, resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Robelito, a factory worker, and she is a mother to three children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Mercedes operates a Barbeque stall. She regularly buys pork, meat and chicken entrails that she prepares and cooks and sells in the afternoon at her barbeque stand near her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of products like meat, pork and other products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Mercedes dreams of being able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a 43 year old single mother of two children. She has been selling fruits wholesale to her customers for the last 17 years, and earns a monthly income of KES. 20,000. 


She has requested a loan worth KES 30,000 to purchase more fruit to meet her customers' demand. The anticipated profit will aid her in repaying the loan. She hopes to grow her business. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits to meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in the South Coast town of Likoni, Kenya. She is a married mother of three children and runs a retail shop which has been in operation for four years.
Rose was introduced to Milango by her friend and decided to join in order to access credit. She has currently applied for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to purchase retail stock which is scarce in the area like sugar, flour etc.
Her main challenge is the seasonal business climate and inflation, but Rose is determined to put all her effort into establishing a wholesale shop in future.

loans.use: To purchase retail stock like sugar, flour etc.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 28 years old. Manuel is married and has no children.

To make a living, Manuel owns and operates a tricycle transport service. (A tricycle is a motorcycle with a passenger cab.) Manuel has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Manuel is requesting a loan of 46,000 PHP, which will be used to pay for the maintenance and repair of his tricycle.

In 2008, Manuel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation.
He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and have an additional unit.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of maintaining and repairing his motorcycle transport vehicle.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.en:
This is Maria Luisa, 46, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rudy, her business partner, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.                             

Maria Luisa operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Maria Luisa hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Hipolito

texts.es: Hipólito es un emprendedor que ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000, para invertir en el negocio en la compra de productos para el negocio el además de venta de mercadería en general tiene otro negocio que es de brindar el servicio de transporte, Hipólito se gana la vida muy honradamente es trabajador y responsable. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de mercadería como pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos, sandalias  entre otra mercadería.
texts.en: Hipólito is an entrepreneur who has been working with Fundación León 2000 to invest in his businesses. He sells general merchandise and has another business, which is providing transportation. Hipólito is a responsible hard worker and makes a living honourably. He is requesting a loan to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses and sandals, among other merchandise.

loans.use: buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses and sandals, among other merchandise.

loans.name: Mwaramwendo

texts.en:
Mwaramwendo is a resident of Likoni, Kenya. She is a married mother of five and owns a food stall which has been operating for four years. She started off by borrowing food items from a nearby shop, and after cooking and selling the food, she would settle the shop bills. She continued with this process until she was able to raise her own capital.
Mwaramwendo is applying for a loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase a sack of beans and baking flour for her food café. 
Her goal is to own a large hotel and despite the seasonal business climate, she will save the additional income for future operations.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of beans and baking flour for her food café.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with three children. 

Felomina has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She is requesting a loan for 30,000 PHP to buy more stock for her store.

Felomina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Felomina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Narcisa has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She is requesting a loan for 20,000 PHP to buy more stock for her store.

Narcisa has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Narcisa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Ainea

texts.en:
Ainea is 44 years old.  He is from Vihiga County and is married to Violet; they have four children.

Ainea is a building contractor, and has been in this business for the last eight years. He is taking his third loan from KADET LTD which he will use to pay school fees for his children. 

His dream is to educate his children through the use of KADET loans.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a 32-year-old Lebanese man living with his wife and two children. He is the main income provider in the family. 

He started to work as a car mechanic and painter six years ago and has his own garage. He is an expert in this field, with twelve years of experience. He has a fair number of customers asking for his services. Today, he needs to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new mechanical and painting tools for his garage. This will help him continue his work in a proper way and respond to his customers’ demands quickly. In the future, he plans to improve his garage and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase new mechanical and painting tools for his garage.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Margarita has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She is requesting a loan for 11,000 PHP to buy more stock for her store.

Margarita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Margarita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Jennifer  Yadilette

texts.es: Jennifer Yadilette es una emprendedora que inicio su propio negocio de la venta de mercadería en general este negocio inicio con capital propio tiene un hijo a su cargo todavía y cada día lucha por darle lo mejor. Este negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante ya tiene sus clientes fijos y eventuales a quienes les ofrece variedad de los productos. Jennifer está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de mercadería como ropa, camisas pantalón, sandalias, cosméticos, blúmer entre otros mercadería.
texts.en: Jennifer Yadilette is an enterprising woman who started her own business selling general merchandise.  She started this business with her own money.  She still has a son under her care and each day she strives to give him the best. She sells her wares on foot and has regular and occasional customers to whom she offers a variety of products.  Jennifer is requesting the loan to purchase merchandise such as clothing, shirts, pants, sandals, cosmetics, panties, and other items.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shirts, pants, sandals, cosmetics, panties, and other merchandise.

loans.name: Norberta

texts.es: Norberta continua con su negocio y principalmente con la ganadería y también continua con la venta de leche y derivados. La socia en esta ocasion desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de una vaca lechera tierna para poder mejorar su produccion.
texts.en: Norberta continues her business, mostly livestock farming and selling milk and milk products. On this occasion, the associate is requesting a loan to buy a cow to improve production.

loans.use: buy a cow to improve production.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina; Continua con su negocio y venta de productos de primera necesidad en su pequeña tienda de abarrotes. la socia desea implementar su tienda y comprar sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, leche, fideos, harinas, huevos entre otros productos..
texts.en: Luz Marina continues her business, selling everyday products in her small grocery store. With the loan, the associate wants to stock her store with bags of rice, bags of sugar, milk, noodles, flour and eggs, among other products.

loans.use: buy bags of rice, bags of sugar, milk, noodles, flour and eggs, among other products.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio tiene 25 años de edad es casado y cuenta con 2 hijos menores, vive junto a su familia en casa propia la cual esta ubicada en un caserío rural de nombre “Chica Alta” del distrito de Tambogrande a unos minutos de la Provincia de Piura. Por ser una comunidad pequeña solo cuentan con servicio de energía eléctrica.

Actualmente Julio se dedica a la venta de cerveza y chicha de jora, para lo cual a acondicionado un espacio en su propio domicilio pues ya cuenta con buena clientela quienes dan muy buenas referencias de la atención que reciben. Adicionalmente también en la parte posterior de su casa se dedica a la crianza, engorde y comercialización de ganado menor y aves de corral, para lo que cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien asume el mismo compromiso de superación y de mejorar su calidad de vida junto a Julio.

En su deseo de engrandecer su negocio esta dispuesto a invertir en la compra de mobiliario (sillas) para su mejor atención al publico asistente y a la vez comprar alimentos balanceados para el mejor engorde de sus animales que cría para poder ponerlos a mejor precio en los mercados locales, para lo que esta solicitando un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1500 Nuevos Soles con los que podrá cumplir con sus objetivos.

Es un cliente conocido por su buen comportamiento de pago en nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Julio, age 25, is married and has two minor children.  He lives with his family in his own house in Chica Alta, a rural settlement in the Tambogrande district, which is a few minutes from the Piura province.  Being a small community, it only has electrical service.

Julio currently sells cerveza and “chicha de jora” (a native corn-based beverage).  In order to do so, he has set up a space in his own home.  He has good customers, and they give him very good references for the attention they receive.  Additionally, in the area behind his house he raises, fattens, and sells small livestock and poultry.  He has his wife’s support in this, and she has the same commitment for self-improvement and improving their quality of life as Julio does.

His wish is to enlarge his business.  He is all set to buy chairs in order to provide his clientele with better attention.  He will also buy balanced feed to better fatten the animals he is raising.  That way he will be able to set a better price for them at the local markets.  

In order to be able to meet his objectives he is requesting a loan for 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  He is a client who is known for his good payment history with our institution.

loans.use: to buy chairs and balanced feed.

loans.name: Bertha Calderon Group

texts.es:
El grupo Bertha Calderon está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadores y emprendedoras una de ellas es Karla Elizabeth quien se dedica a la venta de frijoles, gaseosas, hielo, ropa y cosméticos de todo un poco. El crédito lo invertirá en ropa y su meta es poner una pequeña pulperia.
Ella tiene tres hijos de 18, 16 y 7 años, los mayores le ayudan en el negocio en su tiempo libre junto a su esposo.
Las otras integrantes son Mariela de los Ángeles quien vende chiverías y gaseosas desde hace 4 años y Carolina  quien vende frijoles y elotes.
texts.en:
The Bertha Calderón group consists of three hardworking and enterprising women.  One of them is Karla Elizabeth, who works selling beans, soda, ice, clothing, and cosmetics, a little bit of everything.  She will invest the loan in clothing.  Her goal is to install a small grocery store.

She has three children, ages 18, 16, and 7.  The older ones help her in the business in their spare time, as does her husband.

The other members are Mariela de los Ángeles, who has sold snacks and sodas for four years, and Carolina, who sells beans and corn.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Octavia

texts.es: Octavia continua con su negocios de la ganadería y tambien ella sigue brindando servicios de transportes; la socia cuenta con otra actividad que es la compra y venta de maíz, mas conocido como acopio de maiz. La socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de maíz para acopiarlo y venderlo al por mayor.
texts.en: Octavia continues with her cattle farming business and also continues to provide transportation services.  The member also buys and wells corn and is well-known for her corn collection center.  She is requesting the loan to purchase corn to store and sell wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase corn to store and sell wholesale.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is a 55-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three working children. He’s hoping to collect money and enhance his family’s way of living. Despite all the complications that he might face, Jean was brave and didn’t hesitate to open his own business. Ha started to work as a blacksmith in 1980. He’s a reputable person and has gained a fair number of customers so far. Today, he’s requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to enlarge his shop.  A larger shop will allow him to attract more customers and increase his profits. In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans and renovate his shop.

loans.use: to enlarge his shop.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es:
Jovita continua con su negocio de la compra y venta de granos como trigo, cebada, maíz, habas, morayas, porotos;  tambien continua con la cosecha de sus terrenitos de maíz, ella en esta ocasion desea invertir en la compra de granos secos y en la cosecha de maíz.
 granos.
texts.en: Jovita remains in the business of buying and selling foods such as wheat, barley, corn, broad beans, moraya [a type of frost-treated potato] and other beans. She also continues to harvest her small plots of corn. On this occasion she wishes to invest in the purchase of dried food stuffs and in the harvesting of corn.

loans.use: to invest in dried food stuffs and the harvesting of corn.

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es: Yanet continua con la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas, chanchos.  Y con la compra y venta de maíz al por mayor. La socia en esta ocasion invertira su credito en el acopio de maiz ella comprara de diferentes vecinos su cosecha de maiz para la venta a sus clientes en otras comunidades.
texts.en:
Yanet continues raising small animals like guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs.  She also buys and sells corn wholesale.

On this occasion she will use her loan to stock up on corn.  She will buy the corn harvest from different neighbors, and she will sell to her customers in other communities.

loans.use: to stock up on corn by purchasing the corn harvest from different neighbors and selling it to her customers in other communities.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: Andrea continua con su negocio como comercio de leche; la socia compra y vende leche. Andrea también continua con sus otros negocios alternos de agricultura y venta de madera. La socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de madera.
texts.en: Andrea still operates a business buying and selling milk.  She's still farming, as well, and running her wood sales business.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy wood that she will then resell.

loans.use: to buy wood for her wood sales business.

loans.name: Yunus

texts.en:
Yunus is a resident of Likoni, Kenya. He is a married father of three and owns a mini shop which has been in operation for five years. He is also a farmer and began the business from the sale of the farm produce.
Yunus is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to purchase retail stock like sacks of beans, flour and sugar.
He faces the challenge of a seasonal business climate but would like to supply most of the products to other mini stores in the future.

loans.use: To purchase retail stock like sacks of beans, flour and sugar.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush was born in 1957. She lives in Vanadzor with her husband and her son; her second son is living in Russia with his own young family. 

Anush has a secondary education and for more than twenty years she has been engaged in trading. She rents a stall in a central market of Vanadzor where she sells woman’s shoes. Anush’s husband helps her in the business and in this way they provide for their family, as their son is jobless. Two or three times a month Anush and her husband rent a car and go to Yerevan to purchase merchandise for their business. Anush always has a big choice of goods at her stall so she has many regular customers. 

Anush had already received loans from Nor Horizon five times and now she is asking for a loan of 500.000 Armenian drams to expand the range of spring shoes at her stall.

loans.use: to expand the range of spring shoes on her stall.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es: Juan Bautista es un emprendedor que ha venido trabajando en el financiamiento en la compra de productos para el negocio. Este emprendedor nos expresa que gracias al apoyo que se le ha brindado con  el financiamiento ha aumentado su mercadería de igual manera sus clientes. Actualmente el emprendedor está solicitando financiamiento pero en esta ocasión es para realizarle a su vivienda algunas mejoras lo cual comprara  zinc, piedra hierro, cemento, entre otros materiales de construcción.
texts.en: Juan Bautista is an enterprising man who has used past loans to stock his business.  He tells us that he is grateful for the support that he's received because he's been able to increase the range of products he sells and, in turn, his income.  He is applying for a loan now that he will use to buy construction materials--roofing, construction fill, concrete, etc--for a house improvement project.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for improving his house.

loans.name: Moises Walter

texts.es:
Moisés es un hombre que lamentablemente está separado  pero tiene un pequeño de 9 años, al cual ama mucho y desea que salga adelante y pueda algún día convertirse en un gran profesional, para llegar a esta meta, Moisés está esforzándose  desde ya para lograr grandes cosas para su pequeño. 

Actualmente Moisés se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte público en una moto taxi propia donde trabaja un total de 8 horas y atiende a un promedio de 30 clientes a diario, el cree que su negocio tiene éxito porque brinda la seguridad que sus clientes necesitan. Para poder generar mejores ingresos se dedica a trabajar medio tiempo en un grifo. Él demuestra que es un hombre responsable deseoso de poder salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida junto a su hijo.

Con la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva el podrá realizar el reforzamiento de su moto taxi y así podrá tenerla operativa sin tener dificultades en el transcurso de los transportes que realice. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación podrá cumplir su gran sueño “Terminar de construir su casa” y desde luego comprarse una nueva movilidad.
texts.en:
Moisés is a man who, unfortunately, is separated, but he has a nine-year-old child whom he loves very much and wants to get ahead and be able to become a great professional one day.  To achieve this goal, Moisés is making an effort to be able to do great things for his child.

Currently Moisés works offering public transportation service in a motorcycle taxi.  He works a total of eight hours and serves an average of 30 customers a day.  He believes his business is successful because he provides the safety his customers need.  To be able to generate greater income, he works part time in a gas station.  He shows that he is a responsible man who wants to be able to get ahead and improve his quality of life with his son.

With the help of the Kiva lenders he will be able to reinforce his motorcycle taxi and so be able to have it operative without having problems in the course of the trips he makes.  With a lot of effort and dedication he will be able to realize his big dream, "to finish building his house" and, of course, buy himself a new motorcycle.

loans.use: to reinforce his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.es:
Vladimir es un hombre que se esfuerza día a día para poder salir adelante, es por esto que se dedica al transporte público, su esposa tambien lo apoyo en los ingresos vendiendo quesos, ambas actividades les permiten generar los ingresos necesarios para poder mantener a sus dos pequeños de 1 y 4 años, los cuales aún necesitan sus cuidados para su bienestar.

Actualmente Vladimir trabaja un promedio de 10 horas, en las cuales atiende a un promedio de 50 clientes, esto se debe a que en los ultimos años Ica, lugar en donde vive Vladimir, se ha convertido en una de las zonas con mayor actividad económica a nivel nacional, no solo por las grandes masas exportadas al exterior si no tambien que muchos inversores nacionales y extranjeron han invertido en tiendas por departamento en nuestra ciudad y es por esto que muchas más personas necesitan transportarse para asistir a estos lograres como también los trabajadores que necesesitan llegar a tiempo a su trabajo.

Con la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, Vladimir podrá permitirse realizar la reparación de su vehículo, así mismo esto le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y en algun momento poder realizar la compra de propia flota de taxis.
texts.en:
Vladimir works hard every day to get ahead and works in public transportation. His wife also supports the household by selling cheese. Both lines of work help them generate enough income to support their 2 children, 1 and 4, who need their care.

Vladimir works about 10 hours on average and attends to about 50 clients in that time. That’s because the city of Ica has transformed into one of the areas with the highest economic activity at a national level. And not just because of the mass volume transported out of the country, but because national and international investors have invested in department stores in the city and more people need transportation to get to those places, including the employees who need to arrive to work on time.

With the help of Kiva lenders, Vladimir will be able to repair his vehicle, which in turn will improve his income and at some point he’ll be able to buy his own taxi fleet.

loans.use: make repairs to his taxi.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 29 year old single mother of a three year old child. She is a tailor, a business she started one year ago and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

She has requested a loan worth KES 15,000 to purchase sewing and an over lock machine. The profit she makes will help her repay her loan and expand her business. 

Her dream is to own a large factory that manufactures clothes.  This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase sewing and an over lock machine.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a  50-year-old single mother of five ranging in age from 8 to 23 years old, all from Vihiga town, Western Province, Kenya.

Rosemary operates a maize selling business and has been doing this for the last 20 years, she earns a monthly income of KES. 5,000. She is taking her second loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy maize cereal to sell. She will use her profits to expand her business and provide for family needs.

Her dream is to grow her business through KADET financing.

loans.use: to buy stock of maize cereal to sell.
